goal.core.runtime

Class RuntimeManager<D extends Debugger,C extends GOALInterpreter<D>>

  • java.lang.Object
    • goal.core.runtime.RuntimeManager<D,C>
  • Type Parameters:
    D - subclass of Debugger that agents in this runtime will use.
    C - subclass of GOALInterpreter that agents in this runtime will use.
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    Observable<RuntimeEventObserver,RuntimeManager<?,?>,RuntimeEvent>

    public class RuntimeManager<D extends Debugger,C extends GOALInterpreter<D>>
extends java.lang.Object
implements Observable<RuntimeEventObserver,RuntimeManager<?,?>,RuntimeEvent>

    The RuntimeServiceManager is a LOCAL controller. It provides a functionality for managing the GOAL runtime at a high level and can be observed through event listeners.

    A RuntimeSerManager manages the life cycle of a AgentService, MessagingService and EnvironmentService. It also passes events from each service to the other interested servers and any observers of the RuntimeServiceManager itself.

    External observer are are provided with RuntimeEvents to inform them of events in the Runtime.

    A distributed system can contain several RuntimeServiceManagers. These each have their own set of agents. Communication between Agents is handled through the MessagingService. The EnvironmentService provides agents with access to the environment.

    This class is an important node rerouting various events in the system. The rerouting here looks like this:

    • RemoteRuntimeManager -- (AgentBorn| AgentRemoved|RuntimeLaunched) --> AgentService
    • RemoteRuntimeManager -- Environment(Added|Removed)(MsgBoxId) --> EnvironmentService
    • EnvironmentService -- EnvironmentPort(Added|Removed) --> (Add|Remove) EnvironmentPort2RuntimeManager Listener.
    • EnvironmentService -- EnvironmentPort(Added|Removed) --> (Add|Remove) EnvironmentPort2Observers Listener.
    • AgentService -- (AgentBornAndReady|LocalAgentRemoved) --> Observers
    • AgentService -- (AgentBornAndReady|LocalAgentRemoved) --> RemoteRuntimeService

    The RuntimeManager has two types of 'observers':

    • direct observers within this JVM. see addObserver(RuntimeEventObserver).
    • remote observers, working through the Messaging system. These are not registered here as observers but called directly using the MessagingClient#getMessageBoxes(Type, String) call.
    Author:
    K.Hindriks, W.Pasman major code reorganization 25jan2011. All runtime code from the platform manager is now contained here.

      • RuntimeManager

        public RuntimeManager(MessagingService messagingService,
              AgentService<D,C> agentService,
              EnvironmentService environmentService,
              RemoteRuntimeService<D,C> remoteRuntimeService)
               throws GOALLaunchFailureException
        Creates a new runtime service manager to manage a multi-agent system.
        Parameters:
        messagingService - used to facilitate communication between agents and between agents.
        agentService - used to manage agents in the multi-agent system.
        environmentService - used to manage the environment.
        remoteRuntimeService - the remote runtime service.
        Throws:
        GOALLaunchFailureException - when the system could not be launched.

      • addObserver

        public void addObserver(RuntimeEventObserver observer)
        Add a new observer. Nothing happens if observer already there.. Adds observer. New observers will immediately be notified of the state of the runtime through a late listener pattern.
